intro: Anaxeton brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed anaxeton, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, fibrous stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Anaxeton brevipes is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing resilience through deep root systems and water-storing tissues.
